DataElement.preferredDefinition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microbiology Susceptibility Domain Microbial Susceptibility Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests._A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

Concepts.definition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/12/19 Curated to support CDISC Initiative; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Test Name Terminology Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the microbiology susceptibility test name codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether one or more scored mutations of interest that may confer susceptibility in the microorganism is present.

Concepts.definition: An indication as to whether one or more scored mutations of interest that may confer susceptibility in the microorganism is present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test to determine the lowest concentration of a substance that will inhibit a biological or biochemical function, such as microorganism growth or enzymatic activity.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test to determine the lowest concentration of a substance that will inhibit a biological or biochemical function, such as microorganism growth or enzymatic activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

Concepts.definition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the biological or biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of the biological or biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Reference Control Result.

Concepts.longName: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Reference Control Result.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the current IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Subject Result from the baseline visit.

Concepts.longName: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the current IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Subject Result from the baseline visit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the biological or biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of the biological or biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Ref
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Reference Control Result.

Concepts.longName: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Reference Control Result.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the current IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Subject Result from the baseline visit.

Concepts.longName: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the current IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Subject Result from the baseline visit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of titer of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of titer of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

Concepts.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Ref
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the EC50 Subject Result divided by the EC50 Reference Control Result.

Concepts.longName: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism; it is a ratio calculated by the EC50 Subject Result divided by the EC50 Reference Control Result.

PermissibleValues.value: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

Concepts.longName: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
Concepts.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of population growth or replication of a microbial organism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication of reduced or increased susceptibility of a viral organism, or activity of a biological/biochemical reaction in response to the inhibitory concentration (IC50 and/or IC95) of a specific drug.

Concepts.definition: An indication of reduced or increased susceptibility of a viral organism, or activity of a biological/biochemical reaction in response to the inhibitory concentration (IC50 and/or IC95) of a specific drug.

PermissibleValues.value: Diameter of the Zone of Inhibition

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the diameter of the circular region of bacteria growth inhibition that surrounds an antibiotic source on the surface of a cultured plate.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the diameter of the circular region of bacteria growth inhibition that surrounds an antibiotic source on the surface of a cultured plate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether the pre-specified mutations of interest are present in the subject.

Concepts.definition: An indication as to whether the pre-specified mutations of interest are present in the subject.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.
